activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd A Beckius

defendant.name: Beckius, Todd A
defendant.address: c/o Hazelden Center City, 15251 Pleasant Valley Rd, PO Box 11, Center City, MN 55012-0011

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:16 PM 22CF138/22CF64 - Defendant Todd A Beckius appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank appear by zoom for TB. Attorney Frank states that he has been appointed by SPD in 22CF64 but not in 22CF138; believes that he will be.

22CF138 - Attorney Frank has seen the criminal complaint but TB has received it. Max penalties stated. Court speaks about the prior bail hearing and notes that there was a request to go back into a treatment facility. Deputy Gerber has been provided by Holly a letter from Betty Ford. Court review the letter and speaks about betty ford waiting on insurance. Attorney Frank asks for a signature bond with a condition to be transfer to a clinic in MN and participate in the Betty Ford clinic. State objects and states that she is concerned with TB going to a different states. State isn't asking to increase the bond but does ask that the bond not be modified. Court speaks about the offenses and Betty Ford. 

Court amends the bail bond to a signature bond at the time of transportation of TB to a the  Betty Ford Clinic and be transported there and back by a close family member (wife or parents Ruth or Arnie Beckius) or pay the $5000 cash bond for release. 

Condition of release: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on  reasonable demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

States asks that: Defendant take prescription drugs only with a valid prescription. 
Defendant is required to contact Dispatch upon release from the Betty Ford.

Court agrees to add the above conditions to the bond pertaining to prescription drugs and required to contact dispatch upon release.

Attorney Harper ask for a status within 3 weeks where TB can appear by zoom.

Attorney Frank waives the time limits to a preliminary hearing.
Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Todd A Beckius
Current: c/o Hazelden Center City, 15251 Pleasant Valley Rd, PO Box 11, Center City, MN 55012-0011 United States  (Effective: 08-31-2022)
Prior: 30322 Eagle Cave Dr., Muscoda, WI 53573 

NOTED ON THE RECORD THIS DATE

3:41 PM Defendant Todd A Beckius appeared by video.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Todd A Beckius.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Frank states Def is presently at an in-patient treatment facility in Minnesota; he and counsel went through the prelim waiver yesterday. Def states he believes he'll be done with the inpatient part of the program in two months. Court excuses his appearance today and proceeds with the prelim waiver colloquy. Waiver accepted. Bindover ordered. State is bringing forth same charges as the complaint. Atty. Frank waives reading of the anticipated information; Def stands mute for entry of NG pleas. Status requested and set.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

(Note: Defendant has case 22CF57 in front of Judge Matt Allen. The two cases cannot "track" together as they are in front of different court officials)
Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on August 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:11 PM 22CF57/22CF67 - Defendant Todd A Beckius in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Todd A Beckius.  Attorney Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank waives the formal reading and the time limits for a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

No possession of consumption of alcohol. No entry into bars/taverns or liquor stores/establishments., Phoenix Center included. Submit to testing of blood, breath or urine, at demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance.

12:55 PM Defendant Todd A Beckius in court. Attorney McDougal appears by video. 

State asks for a $1,000 cash bond
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Attorney McDougal comments about the defendant and asks for a $500 cash bail instead of a $1,000 cash bond.

Court orders a $1,000 cash bond
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 


Initial set for June 8 at 2:30 PM

Attorney McDougal ask that his other case be moved to 06/08/22 at 2:30.
